## Government Tender Announcement
### Title 
Stage 1 - Snaring Bridge Rehabilitation – Jasper National Park

### Tender Details
- Reference Number: cb-5059-80049049
- Solicitation Number: 5P468-23-0043/A
- Publication Date: April 26, 2023
- Tender Closing Date: May 18, 2023 at 16:00:00

### Contract Overview
Parks Canada is seeking a contractor for the rehabilitation of the Snaring River Bridge located on Snaring Road, approximately 17 km Northwest of the townsite of Jasper. The scope of work includes:
1. Demolishing damaged asphalt plank seal coat, asphalt plank, laminated deck, concrete, camber shim plates, damaged timber curb, and existing deck joints.
2. Supplying and installing timber end block with steel angle EMSEAL joints, curb segments with through drains, timber deck and new chip seal coat, guardrails, class 2 riprap, and cast-in-place concrete shear blocks.
3. Repairing concrete on vertical and horizontal surfaces at bridge abutments and piers, and damaged sections of bridge rail.
4. Removing debris at substructure and truss connection points.
5. Tightening loose bolts and installing new bolts at locations where existing bolts are missing.
6. Lead paint abatement at localized areas as required.

### Instructions to Bidders
- The two-stage selection process will evaluate the qualifications of interested suppliers in the first stage and invite qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid on the project in the second stage.
- Bidders must submit their response in two stages.
- Bidders must submit their response via email or fax as indicated in the solicitation document.
- Bidders can only submit their response via the email address soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca.
- Email size should not exceed 15 megabytes.

### Evaluation Criteria
- Technical and contractual inquiries will be evaluated by the Contracting Authority.
- The evaluation will consider factors such as the bidder's qualifications and experience, bid price, and adherence to the scope of work.

### Notice to Bidders
- Parks Canada reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
- The crown retains the right to negotiate the contract terms.
- Bidders are expected to submit their response in English or French.
- Documentation may be submitted in both official languages of Canada.
- Addenda, when issued, will be available on the Canada Buys website.
